page.title: 15BLACK AND WHITE WHISKY
page.content: The ancient Celts had a name for the precious liquid they distilled - {"Uisge Beatha"}-the water of life. On the outskirts of Glasgow in Stepps is situated the{"Black and {White"}Scotch blending and bottling plant which was opened in 1969. It consists of huge low buildings spread beneath an office tower ten storeys high which is a landmark for miles around. Within these buildings the many whiskies are blended and stored ready for bottling. The Black and White company was founded by{James {Buchanan}and "Black and White" Scotch Whisky was registered as a trade mark in 1904. Since the 1890's the Black and White dogs, the Highland terriers, have been a feature of the company's advertising. Today Black and White Scotch Whisky is sold in over 160 overseas markets.
